intro: Johnstonella inaequata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed rockrose, is a flowering plant species native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its succulent, evergreen leaves and showy, pink or purple flowers. The plant typically grows on rocky outcrops and has adapted to withstand drought conditions through its thick, waxy leaf cuticle. Johnstonella inaequata is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in xeriscapes due to its low water requirements. Its botanical features make it a resilient and visually striking addition to gardens in dry climates.
